oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Muster-out roll of John Morrisey, 10th Regiment, Tennessee Infantry

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Registers, lists, etc.; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; United States -- War Dept. -- Adjutant-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-page form that constitutes the official release of John Morrisey, private in the 10th Regiment, Tennessee Infantry, from service in the United States Army, issued May 29, 1865.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- War Dept. -- Adjutant-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Record Group 21, Adjutant General's Office Records, 1796-1900
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Muster-out rolls were often the last official records related to a soldier's active service in the United States Army. They include date and location mustered in, names of commanding officers, terms of service, dates and amounts of last payment and/or equipment compensation, entitlements as a discharged soldier, name of official mustering the soldier out, reason for discharge, and type of discharge (honorable, dishonorable, etc.)
